main event: On April 27, 1956, in Greensboro, North Carolina, a simultaneous sighting of three unidentified flying objects occurred - two similar and one dissimilar.
interesting points: The silver object and two copper-colored objects were observed by two individuals, one of whom was nearsighted and the other farsighted, providing multiple perspectives on the sighting.
The silver object was described as a brilliant silver object without sound or tail, moving diagonally from the sky and disappearing suddenly near the tops of tall trees.
The copper-colored objects were observed maintaining the same relative position throughout the sighting, moving steadily in a straight line from north to southwest.
The objects were described as having unusual shapes, with one being elliptical and the other about half the size of the first.
The observation lasted approximately 2.5 minutes, with the objects seen at a tremendous distance and at great altitude.
sighted object: three unidentified flying objects - a silver object and two copper-colored objects
witnesses: Two individuals - one nearsighted and one farsighted
